definition: hell on earth (idiom); suffering the torments of Buddhist hell while still alive/fig. having an uncomfortable time
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: "By the time we got home," he once said, "it was hell on earth."
sentences.chinese: 博格寧曾經說回家就像被打入人間地獄一樣。

sentences.english: Nanjing of the time was a field littered with corpses, just like the world hell.
sentences.chinese: 當時的南京城屍橫遍野，淪爲人間地獄。
